member.name: T:Amazon.Outposts.Model.ListOutpostsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListOutposts operation. Create a list of the Outposts for your AWS account. Add filters to your request to return a more specific list of results. Use filters to match an Outpost lifecycle status, Availibility Zone (us-east-1a), and AZ ID (use1-az1).
If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Outposts.Model.ListOutpostsRequest.AvailabilityZoneFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailabilityZoneFilter.
A filter for the Availibility Zone (us-east-1a) of the Outpost.
Filter values are case sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values.

member.name: P:Amazon.Outposts.Model.ListOutpostsRequest.AvailabilityZoneIdFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailabilityZoneIdFilter.
A filter for the AZ IDs (use1-az1) of the Outpost.
Filter values are case sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values.

member.name: P:Amazon.Outposts.Model.ListOutpostsRequest.LifeCycleStatusFilter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LifeCycleStatusFilter.
A filter for the lifecycle status of the Outpost.
Filter values are case sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values.

member.name: T:Amazon.Outposts.AmazonOutpostsClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing Outposts
AWS Outposts is a fully managed service that extends AWS infrastructure, APIs, and tools to customer premises. By providing local access to AWS managed infrastructure, AWS Outposts enables customers to build and run applications on premises using the same programming interfaces as in AWS Regions, while using local compute and storage resources for lower latency and local data processing needs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Outposts.AmazonOutpostsClient.Paginators
member.summary: Paginators for the service

member.name: M:Amazon.Outposts.AmazonOutpostsClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonOutpostsClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.Outposts.AmazonOutpostsClient.ListOutposts(Amazon.Outposts.Model.ListOutpostsRequest)
member.summary:
Create a list of the Outposts for your AWS account. Add filters to your request to return a more specific list of results. Use filters to match an Outpost lifecycle status, Availibility Zone (us-east-1a), and AZ ID (use1-az1).
If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListOutposts service method.

member.name: M:Amazon.Outposts.IAmazonOutposts.ListOutposts(Amazon.Outposts.Model.ListOutpostsRequest)
member.summary:
Create a list of the Outposts for your AWS account. Add filters to your request to return a more specific list of results. Use filters to match an Outpost lifecycle status, Availibility Zone (us-east-1a), and AZ ID (use1-az1).
If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListOutposts service method.
